restaurants.lic_search_name: Against the Grain Urban Tavern - Corus
lic_profile: Enjoy a bold urban tavern experience at the new Against The Grain, located in the Corus Quay building, at Cherry Beach, with a breathtaking view of Centre Island and the waterfront. The menu balances traditional tavern offerings with bold, unexpected flavours complemented with a true craft experience of rotating craft pours and hand-crafted cocktails. Cozy up in the lounge and enjoy a social with friends or pull up to "the wood" to watch the game. Either way, stop in and experience the new Against The Grain - change is good.

lic_profile: A quaint, neighbourhood restaurant, Aioli Bistro is located in the heart of Cliffside Village not far from the Scarborough Bluffs. The menu features dishes from the South of France including classics such as confit de canard and cassoulet paired with a selection of primarily French wines handpicked to enhance your dining experience. The decor, candle lit dining room and sounds of Piaf, Brel & Aznavour make one feel as if they are in a small village bistro in France. The experience is further enhanced by the chef and friendly staff as they greet guests, explain the dishes and ensure a wonderful meal.

lic_profile: Most appropriately named, music lovers and food enthusiasts have made Alleycatz a popular dining and party destination. lic_profile: Aria offers genuine Italian fine dining in a contemporary urban setting. Aria is owned by Guido Saldini and Elena Morelli the proprietors of Noce Restaurant which has helped set the standard for Italian cuisine in Toronto for almost 20 years.  "Aria" means "air" in Italian but also references the most Italian of art forms - opera.  Both themes are evident inside Aria which boasts a dramatic 35 foot ceiling and is situated adjacent to the Air Canada Centre and Maple Leaf Square. Aria has dining capacity for 130 people and can accommodate private parties in a variety of formats.

lic_profile: Housed in a historical building, Bangkok Garden is one of the first restaurants to introduce traditional Thai cuisine and culture to Toronto over 30 years ago, and is acclaimed as one of North America's premier Thai restaurants. One of only four Toronto restaurants to be awarded the Thai Select Premium designation from the Thai government, recognizing authenticity of food and outstanding service, Bangkok Garden serves food based on the Thai principle of balancing the five tastes: sweet, hot, sour, salty and bitter, including fiery stir fry and flavourful curries. The bar offers a large selection of exotic cocktails, international beers and an extensive wine list.

lic_profile: Bar Buca is an Italian-style eatery where one can begin their day over house made pastries and perfectly prepared specialty coffee. A unique, carefully crafted cocktail list of Italian classics, alongside a thorough wine list including 21 selections by the glass, complete every meal.

Whether seated on Bar Buca's intimate front patio or inside the dining room with a view into the electric energy of the open kitchen, guests will appreciate its mix of industrial aesthetics with classic materials. The combination of inspired design and a finely curated drinks list and menu makes Bar Buca a Toronto favourite with patrons and critics alike.

lic_profile: Diwan's elegant interior evokes the luxury of a private Syrian home in the early 19th century.  Sumptuously decorated with wooden panels inset with mirrors, the room extends the Museum experience to diners: the panels are original and form part of the Aga Khan Museum's Permanent Collection.  Diwan's floor-to-ceiling windows offer a stunning view of the formal garden of the Aga Khan Park designed by Lebanon-based landscape architect Vladimir Djurovic, who visited the world's historic Islamic gardens for inspiration.

Master Chef Mark McEwan and Chef de Cuisine John Kovac offer a menu that highlights flavours and fragrances from the Middle East, North Africa and the Indian subcontinent. Prepared with local and international ingredients, the menu celebrates the many textures and flavours of traditional cuisine with unexpected twists on spicy and savoury dishes.

lic_profile: Fring‚Äôs is the Bent-Lee boys‚Äô latest and most ambitious venture. A breathtaking dining space with a cool and global fine dining vibe and aesthetic, it opened its doors last October on King Street West. Years of experience working for the family operations, Susur, Lee, and Bent, provided them with intimate knowledge of the dining industry.

The menu at Fring's, reflects the now comfort-food trend, along with acknowledgement to Toronto foodies‚Äô appetites for palate-expanding world cuisine, was developed by the Bent-Lee sons, along side with their father, world renowned Chef Susur Lee.  Accompanying the menu is an extensive wine & cocktail list, curated to further complement the vast diversity of flavours and textures.

lic_profile: The first North American location of Jamie Oliver‚Äôs internationally known brand of restaurant opened in 2015 at Toronto‚Äôs Yorkdale Shopping Centre. Jamie‚Äôs Italian has an inviting, relaxed atmosphere, consistent with other locations worldwide offering simple, freshly made Italian-inspired dishes with a Jamie twist. Focusing on fresh, sustainable ingredients and bold, classic flavours, the nofuss menu includes delicious bruschettas, made-to order pizzas, and antipasti planks of cured meats, cheeses and vegetables.

The restaurant features high ceilings and an open kitchen, accented by vintage school chairs, leather banquettes and a statement wall of reclaimed wood. A welcoming bar and friendly service will make each guest feel like they‚Äôre at their new favourite local gathering spot. The restaurant design is also family-friendly. Unique to the area, a private mezzanine dining area with space to seat 24 for a meal will provide an ideal place for work functions or for family and friends to come together.

lic_profile: Praised as one of the "Ten Chefs of the Millennium" in 2000 by food & Wine magazine, Susur Lee is still at the top of his game. Between helming three restaurants in Toronto - Lee, Bent & Luckee - and overseeing his prestigious TungLok Heen in Singapore, Chef Lee makes numerous television appearances and travels the globe as guest chef and consultant. Balancing the epicurean traditions of China with the classical techniques of French cuisines, Chef Lee improvises a daring and original culinary aesthetic.

Frequently appearing many of Toronto publication's "Best of" lists, Lee offers a menu inspired by the convergence of land and sea with seasonality in mind.  From the bar comes a sake driven wine list and fresh-to-order cocktails with handmade ingredients.

lic_profile: A Chef Anthony Walsh creation, Le√±a pays homage to his Argentinian mother-in-law, Elena, from whom he has drawn great culinary inspiration, and embodies what he experiences in her kitchen ‚Äì a passionate food philosophy that brings people together. Imaginative yet rooted in tradition, Le√±a‚Äôs cuisine showcases the vibrant essence of South American cooking, with unique Spanish and Italian influences. It, along with the stylish design, warm character and lively tunes, promotes a ‚Äúlive to eat‚Äù ethos and fosters a convivial spirit at the table. Above all, Le√±a celebrates authentic, flavourful food and drink, enjoyed amongst old and new friends.

lic_profile: Miku Toronto, Aburi Restaurant's first east coast location, is situated at Bay and Queen‚Äôs Quay. With over 7000 square feet, a raw bar, sushi bar, large patio and private dining rooms, Miku brings contemporary upscale design to the southern Financial District. Corporate Executive Chef Kazuya Matsuoka along with Chef de Cuisine Michael Acero and Head Sushi Chef Kazuki Uchigoshi bring Aburi Cuisine to Toronto combining traditional Japanese flavours and techniques with local, East Coast elements to create a truly unique dining experience. The menu focuses on Aburi Sushi as well as fresh seafood, respecting the natural flavours of the ingredients while adding a signature Aburi twist. Japanese and European inspired desserts made in house create the perfect ending to the culinary experience. The menu is complemented with signature cocktails, wines, and an extensive sake list. Knowledgeable staff is always happy to make suggestions on pairings that will please your palate.

Located in the heart of downtown, Nota Bene is steps away from the Theatre District and Four Seasons Centre for the Performing Arts. Dishes are true to their respective origins and live happily together on a single menu, representing the city‚Äôs motto: ‚ÄòDiversity our Strength‚Äô. Chef/Partner Dustin Gallagher, recently of Top Chef Canada All-Stars, helms the kitchen with a menu driven by ‚Äòcrunch-to-squish ratio‚Äô, fun-to-eat, punchy-flavoured, technique-driven dishes. The bar program by managing partner, Matt See, includes carefully chosen beer, wine and cocktail lists which round out Peoples Eatery‚Äôs offerings. Dining at the bar or in a number of private spaces for larger groups makes Peoples a distinctively unique restaurant in an unexpected location: look for candle light in the front windows.
